item.title: Data loss prevention policies for Google Calendar now available in beta
item.description: Google is extending Data Loss Prevention (DLP) capabilities to Google Chat, allowing admins to create custom rules to prevent sensitive information from being shared within messages and spaces. This enhancement, available to specific Google Workspace Enterprise and Education customers, applies to all new and edited Chat messages to bolster data security, ensure compliance, and prevent data exfiltration. The feature is enabled by default and rolls out starting February 13, 2026.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - February 6, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace Weekly Recap for February 6, 2026, introduced several key updates, including enhanced Google Meet companion mode for more inclusive hybrid meetings available to all Workspace customers. Google Docs received new smart chips for improved project management, while Google Drive's AI-powered search within shared drives was refined for Business, Enterprise, Education, and Nonprofits. Additionally, Google Chat now supports custom emojis for all users, and the Google Workspace Admin Console gained granular external sharing security settings for Business Standard and higher editions.

item.title: Expanding access to select Google Vids features for all users
item.description: Google Vids, the AI-powered video creation app within Google Workspace, is expanding access to more Workspace customers, including those on Business Standard and Plus, Enterprise Starter, Standard, Plus, and Education Plus tiers. This tool utilizes generative AI to assist with scriptwriting, storyboarding, and raw cut generation, streamlining the creation of business videos for various purposes. It integrates seamlessly with existing Workspace applications like Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides, enhancing collaboration and content management.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 30, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace Weekly Recap for January 30, 2026, unveiled key enhancements including improved Smart Chips and templates in Google Docs, refined conditional formatting and pivot table controls in Google Sheets, and new presenter tools for Google Slides. Significant AI integration was noted with Google Meet gaining AI-powered noise cancellation and expanded live captions, while Gemini provided new summarization in Docs, email drafting in Gmail, and Q&A in Sheets. Security was also boosted with enhanced suspicious activity alerts in Google Drive and new DLP policies via the Google Admin Console.

item.title: All Google Forms will now have granular controls over who can respond
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new granular controls for Google Forms, empowering administrators with enhanced capabilities to manage response collection and sharing. This update allows admins to set specific limits on submissions and dictate how responses are stored and accessed, improving data privacy and organizational efficiency. The improvements are particularly beneficial for educational institutions and businesses handling sensitive information, streamlining form management and data compliance.

item.title: Record audio, video, and screencasts directly in Google Classroom
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing Google Classroom with new integrated tools for recording screencasts, audio, and video directly within the platform. This feature enables educators and students to easily create and share dynamic instructional content, video assignments, and presentations. The update aims to streamline the creation of engaging multimedia resources, supporting more flexible and interactive learning experiences in hybrid and remote education settings.

item.title: January Workspace Drop: SOTA AI avatars in Vids, deeper insights in the Gemini app, and new app integrations in Chat
item.description: The January Workspace Drop introduces significant AI-powered enhancements across Google Workspace, prominently featuring Gemini integration in Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, Gmail, Meet, and Chat, enabling features like "Help me write" in Docs and AI-powered summarization in Chat. Updates also boost productivity with new organizing features and improved search in Google Drive, smart fill for data cleanup in Google Sheets, and enhanced collaboration tools in Google Meet's companion mode and picture-in-picture. These advancements aim to streamline workflows, enhance data management, and improve security within the Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: Calendar event color labels now also accessible to users with “Make changes to events” permission
item.description: Google Calendar is rolling out an update to enhance the accessibility and ease of modifying event color labels directly within the calendar interface. This improvement allows Google Workspace users to more efficiently customize their event organization, promoting clearer schedule management and improved accessibility for diverse user needs. The update aims to streamline how users interact with their daily appointments and tasks in Google Calendar, often integrated with tools like Google Meet and Google Drive.

item.title: Take your notebooks further by adding NotebookLM as a source in the Gemini app
item.description: NotebookLM, Google's AI-powered research and note-taking tool, is significantly enhanced by integrating with Gemini 1.5 Pro, allowing it to summarize Google Docs, PDFs, and web content, and analyze multiple sources to answer complex questions. The updated platform introduces a "Fact Check" feature for source verification and leverages Google Drive for document sourcing, serving as a comprehensive AI assistant for students, researchers, and writers in over 200 countries.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 23, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace weekly recap for January 23, 2026, highlights several key updates including enhanced Google Docs version history, AI-driven pivot table insights in Google Sheets, and new background customization options for Google Meet. Additionally, the recap covers improved security alerts for Google Drive sharing and expanded Gemini integrations across Workspace applications. These updates collectively aim to boost productivity, security, and collaboration for users across the enterprise.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 16, 2026
item.description: The Google Workspace Weekly Recap for January 16, 2026, highlighted significant updates including enhanced AI capabilities in Google Docs for summarizing and drafting, and improved collaboration features in Google Sheets with better version history and comment threading. Additionally, security enhancements were rolled out for Google Drive, focusing on advanced data loss prevention, alongside new integrations for Google Meet and ongoing developments with Gemini for Workspace.

item.title: Maximize output, minimize effort: Google Workspace with Gemini helps you move work forward in meetings
item.description: Google Workspace is making Gemini's AI capabilities generally available to all paying customers, significantly enhancing meeting productivity with features like "Take notes for me" in Google Meet, which automatically generates summaries, key points, and action items. This integration also introduces "Meet Companion Mode" for improved participation and "Translate in Google Meet" for real-time multi-language captions, all built on Google's responsible AI principles to ensure data privacy and security. These AI-powered tools connect seamlessly with other Workspace apps, including Docs, Sheets, and Slides, to streamline workflows across various business and education editions.

item.title: Editing password-protected Microsoft Office files directly in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive now allows users to open, edit, and save password-protected Microsoft Office files (DOCX, XLSX, PPTX) directly within Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides on both web and mobile (iOS/Android). This update streamlines collaboration by removing the need to remove password protection, enhancing productivity and security for shared documents. This feature enables real-time co-editing and version control without compromising file integrity.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - January 9, 2026
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for January 9, 2026, details several key updates: Google Chat is receiving enhanced file discovery features, while Google Meet gains more granular admin controls for external participant access and recording policies via the Google Admin console. Additionally, Google Drive is rolling out AI-powered suggestions for file organization, and Gemini integration in Google Docs is expanding to offer advanced summarization and draft generation capabilities, boosting AI-powered productivity.

item.title: Now generally available: Migrate files from Dropbox to Google Drive
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new migration capabilities, expected in January 2026, enabling users to seamlessly transfer files and folders directly from Dropbox into Google Drive. This update aims to simplify data migration for organizations adopting Google Workspace, providing administrators with streamlined tools for secure and efficient cloud storage consolidation. The feature enhances Google Drive's integration, facilitating easier transitions for businesses moving their data within the Google ecosystem.

item.title: Manage Apple Intelligence Writing Tools in Google Workspace iOS apps
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new administrative controls to manage Apple's Scribble feature within Workspace applications on iOS devices. This update allows administrators to enable or disable the use of Apple Pencil's handwriting-to-text functionality for end-users when interacting with Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides on managed iPhones and iPads. The feature aims to provide IT departments with enhanced oversight regarding data input methods into critical business applications, balancing productivity with compliance and security needs.

item.title: Google Workspace audit log API enhancements now available
item.description: The Google Workspace Audit Log API is now Generally Available, offering administrators programmatic access to critical security logs from services like Google Drive, Google Calendar, Admin, Google Meet, and Google Groups. This API facilitates robust integration with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) platforms, including Splunk and Microsoft Sentinel. The enhancement significantly improves an organization's visibility into Workspace activity, aiding in incident detection, response, and compliance efforts.

item.title: How Bison Coolers relies on Google to run its family business
item.description: Bison Coolers, a premium outdoor gear manufacturer, revolutionized its operations by integrating Google Pixel 7 Pro and Pixel 8 Pro smartphones with Google Workspace for its employees. CEO Jeremy Ggoins, Operations Manager Brian Miller, and Digital Marketing Manager Jeff Minter utilize Pixel devices to streamline inventory management, quality control, and remote factory communications through Google Meet and secure Google Drive access, enhancing collaboration and problem-solving. This adoption provides field reps with secure data access and demonstration tools, improving overall efficiency and reducing operational downtime.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - December 19, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for December 19, 2025, highlighted significant platform enhancements, including the rollout of Gemini-powered image generation directly within Workspace applications, designed with robust content safety features for all users. The recap also announced the General Availability of the Google Workspace Audit Log API, which provides administrators programmatic access to security logs from various Workspace services for improved threat detection and compliance. These updates collectively reinforce Google's ongoing commitment to advancing both productivity and security capabilities within its Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: A breakthrough year for apps in Google Chat
item.description: Google is evolving its Chat app framework for Google Workspace, aiming for richer, more dynamic user experiences and developer capabilities by Q1 2025. This initiative will enable more interactive bots and seamless integrations with business applications directly within Google Chat, enhancing productivity and collaboration. Developers will need to update existing apps using new tools and migration guides to leverage these advancements.

item.title: Google Workspace is the “new default” for The Carbon Group's fractional C-suite services
item.description: The Carbon Group, an Australian financial services firm, transitioned 180 employees from Microsoft to Google Workspace, standardizing on tools like Google Sheets, Drive, Meet, Gmail, and Docs. This move significantly improved collaboration, security, and productivity across their 13 offices, enabling real-time file sharing, streamlined communication, and efficient onboarding of new team members. The shift has made Google Workspace the company's default platform, centralizing operations and enhancing the hybrid work experience.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - December 5, 2025
item.description: This week's Google Workspace updates include the launch of Workspace Studio for AI-powered solution creation, Gemini insights for Google Drive folders, and a refreshed user interface for Google Drive's web file viewer. Additionally, Google Meet hardware now supports BYOD functionality via Chrome OS touch controllers and introduces seamless room connection for meetings.

item.title: A more modern interface for viewing PDFs, videos, images, and audio files in Google Drive on the web
item.description: Google Drive on the web is introducing a refreshed, modern file viewer interface, aligning with Material Design 3 for improved navigation and accessibility. This update, rolling out gradually from December 16, 2025, enhances the user experience and provides consistency across Google Workspace applications.

item.title: Get quick insights on your Google Drive folders with Gemini
item.description: Gemini in Google Workspace now provides AI-powered insights for Google Drive folders, allowing users to quickly understand content, identify key information, and summarize documents within their files. This new capability, available for Workspace Enterprise, Education, and other specific editions, significantly boosts productivity and content management efficiency.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 28, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace's weekly recap for November 28, 2025, highlights several key updates including granular OAuth consent for web apps and enhanced visibility of data classification labels in Google Drive for end-users. Other significant improvements include deeper integration with Egnyte, improved Meet streaming metrics, expanded language support for Drive video captions, and the introduction of Gemini in Google Classroom for higher education. These updates aim to boost security, collaboration, and accessibility across the Workspace suite.

item.title: How Bison Coolers relies on Google to run its family business
item.description: Bison Coolers, a Texas-based family business manufacturing rotomolded coolers, transitioned from a costly Microsoft Exchange setup to Google Workspace to enhance collaboration and reduce IT overhead. Leveraging tools like Gmail, Google Drive, Docs, and Sheets, alongside Google Meet and Chat, the company streamlined communication, enabled remote work, and scaled from three to over 20 employees. This shift significantly improved productivity for traveling sales teams, provided cost savings, and bolstered disaster recovery capabilities for their growing business operations.

item.title: November Workspace Drop: Nano Banana Pro in Slides, Vids, and the Gemini app, plus AI to make meetings more impactful
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing a suite of new AI-powered features, including Google Vids, an AI-powered video creation app to generate scripts and storyboards from scratch, set to launch in Workspace Labs in 2024. Google Slides will gain a 'Help me visualize' feature for generative AI image creation and Gemini integration for drafting, while Google Meet receives background music and enhanced audio capabilities, and Google Docs sees smart chip improvements. These updates aim to significantly boost productivity and creativity across the Workspace ecosystem.

item.title: Automatically generated captions for videos in Google Drive now available in more languages
item.description: Google Drive has significantly expanded its video captioning capabilities, now supporting over 20 new languages for auto-generated captions beyond English. This update aims to enhance accessibility and foster global collaboration for all Google Workspace customers and personal Google Account users. The feature is rolling out now, with a scheduled release for all users starting December 9, 2025.

item.title: Data classification labels visible in more places across Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is enhancing data security and user awareness by making data classification labels, previously admin-facing, visible directly to end-users on files in Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides. This feature, available for Workspace Enterprise Plus, Education Standard, and Education Plus customers, aims to promote responsible data handling by clearly indicating sensitivity levels like "Confidential" or "Internal." The rollout begins immediately for Rapid Release domains and December 9, 2025, for Scheduled Release.

item.title: Collaborate seamlessly across Google Workspace and Egnyte
item.description: Google Workspace has launched an enhanced integration with Egnyte, allowing users to seamlessly access, edit, and collaborate on Egnyte files directly from Google Workspace applications such as Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides. This streamlines workflows for organizations leveraging both platforms, fostering greater productivity and ensuring data consistency. The feature is rolling out to all Google Workspace customers, with a full deployment expected by December 9, 2025.

item.title: Single-sign on with custom OpenID Connect profiles now generally available
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing its security and access management capabilities by introducing support for custom OpenID Connect (OIDC) providers for Single Sign-On (SSO), moving beyond traditional SAML-based identity providers. This update offers organizations greater flexibility to integrate existing OIDC-compliant identity providers for authenticating users across Google Workspace applications like Drive, Gmail, and Docs. The feature will be available to all Google Workspace editions, including Business Standard and Enterprise Plus, starting in late Q4 2025.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 14, 2025
item.description: The weekly recap for November 7, 2025, highlights several Google Workspace updates, including new controls in Google Chat for restricting conversation creation and the ability to set sharing expirations for files and folders in Google Drive. Additionally, Google Calendar now supports secondary calendar management with dedicated owners, and Google Meet offers an option for longer meeting notes.

item.title: Analyze large-scale .csv files in Google Sheets with a new direct-to-BigQuery import
item.description: Google Sheets now enables users to analyze large-scale CSV files stored in Google Drive, supporting datasets up to 10 million cells without impacting the Sheet's internal cell limit. Rolling out from November 11, 2025, this enhancement allows for efficient data exploration, filtering, sorting, and pivot table creation on massive datasets.

item.title: Available in open beta: Migrate files from Dropbox to Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is simplifying the migration process from Dropbox, allowing administrators to seamlessly transfer files and folder structures to Google Drive. This update aims to ease the transition for organizations consolidating their cloud storage solutions and enhances data management within Google Workspace.

item.title: New AI-powered audio overviews for PDFs in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is introducing AI-powered audio overviews for PDFs, allowing users to listen to summaries of their documents instead of reading them. This accessibility feature leverages artificial intelligence to quickly convey key information from complex documents, enhancing productivity and information consumption on the go.

item.title: Leverage the power of Gemini models to apply data classification labels in Google Drive - beta applications now open
item.description: Gemini is integrating with Google Drive to provide AI-powered data classification, automatically categorizing and tagging files based on their content. This enhancement helps organizations improve data governance, security, and discoverability by ensuring sensitive information is correctly identified and managed.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - November 7, 2025
item.description: This weekly recap for November 7, 2025, summarizes key updates across Google Workspace, including advancements in Google Meet for longer meeting notes, Google Drive's new migration tools from Dropbox, and enhanced secondary calendar management in Google Calendar. It highlights a range of improvements aimed at boosting productivity and collaboration for users.

item.title: Gemini Deep Research now integrates with your Workspace content
item.description: Gemini is now integrating deep research capabilities directly with Google Workspace content, allowing users to leverage AI for comprehensive analysis of their own documents, emails, and shared files. This feature significantly enhances information synthesis and productivity by providing AI-driven insights relevant to a user's specific work context.

item.title: Set sharing expirations on files and folders in shared drives
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing data security and management by allowing users to set sharing expirations for files and folders directly within Google Drive. This feature ensures that access to sensitive documents automatically revokes after a specified period, reducing the risk of unauthorized long-term access and improving compliance.

item.title: October Workspace Drop: New AI-powered storytelling, research, and data protections
item.description: The October Google Workspace drop introduces new AI-powered features focused on storytelling, research, and data protection. Updates include AI-generated video creation in Google Vids, enhanced research capabilities in NotebookLM and Google Search, and advanced data protection measures like client-side encryption for Google Drive and Gmail to bolster security and compliance.

item.title: How Augustana University is building its future with Google Workspace and NotebookLM
item.description: Augustana University is leveraging Google Workspace, including Google Docs and Google Classroom, along with NotebookLM, to enhance teaching, learning, and administrative efficiency for its 2,500 students and 500 staff. NotebookLM, powered by Gemini, allows students and faculty to rapidly synthesize information from vast academic sources, saving significant research time and fostering deeper understanding of complex topics.

item.title: Educators can now convert rubrics in Google Classroom from Drive or local files with help from Gemini
item.description: Educators can now use Gemini to convert rubrics from Google Classroom and Google Drive into various formats, streamlining the assessment and feedback process. This AI-powered tool simplifies grading and helps teachers efficiently adapt rubrics for different assignments or share them across platforms, saving valuable time.

item.title: Introducing Business Continuity editions: Support business continuity and resilience for enterprise customers
item.description: Google Workspace is introducing new Business Continuity Editions designed to ensure organizations maintain operations during outages or disasters, offering enhanced resilience and recovery options. These editions provide advanced backup, data replication, and failover capabilities, underscoring Google's commitment to enterprise reliability and data protection.

item.title: Break free from Microsoft 365’s lock-in, vulnerabilities, and outages with Google Workspace and partners
item.description: Google Workspace is presented as a robust alternative to Microsoft 365, offering superior business continuity and collaboration features through its integrated AI-powered applications. Recent enhancements, including new AI features for Gemini and improved security, aim to provide a reliable and efficient platform for organizations seeking to maintain seamless operations and enhance productivity.

item.title: Summarize shared files with Gemini in Google Chat, now available on mobile
item.description: Gemini Chat on mobile devices now allows users to summarize files directly from Google Drive, including Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides, providing quick access to document insights on the go. This enhancement, available from October 28, 2025, significantly improves mobile productivity and information retrieval efficiency for Workspace users.

item.title: Block ransomware proliferation and easily restore files with AI in Google Drive
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing its security with new AI-powered ransomware detection capabilities directly within Google Drive, providing advanced protection against evolving cyber threats. This feature proactively identifies suspicious files and activity patterns, alerting users and administrators to potential attacks, thereby helping to prevent data loss and maintain business continuity.

item.title: Ransomware detection and file restoration for Google Drive available in beta
item.description: Google Drive is rolling out enhanced ransomware detection and simplified file restoration capabilities to bolster data security and recovery. Available from September 30, 2025, this feature protects against malicious attacks by identifying suspicious activity and enabling quick recovery of previous file versions.

item.title: Meet eCDN custom rules improvements for new and existing configurations
item.description: The Weekly Recap for September 26, 2025, highlights new features such as the Chat apps carousel, Markdown support, and code blocks in Google Chat. It also details enhancements to Gemini's collaboration features within Google Drive, summarizing recent improvements across communication and AI-powered document management.

item.title: Collaborate with Gemini in Google Drive now available on mobile
item.description: Gemini is expanding its collaborative AI capabilities to Google Drive on both iOS and Android mobile devices, enabling users to interact with AI for document assistance while on the go. Rolling out from September 23, 2025, this feature allows mobile users to leverage Gemini for tasks like summarization, brainstorming, and content generation directly within their Drive files.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - September 26, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for September 26, 2025, highlights new features such as the Chat apps carousel, Markdown support, and code blocks in Google Chat. It also details enhancements to Gemini's collaboration features within Google Drive, summarizing recent improvements across communication and AI-powered document management.

item.title: Upcoming Change to Drive Sharing Permissions
item.description: Google Drive is implementing an upcoming change to its sharing settings, introducing more explicit controls and warnings to prevent accidental oversharing of sensitive documents. Rolling out from September 9, 2025, this update aims to significantly enhance data security and privacy, particularly for enterprise users managing confidential information.

item.title: Google Workspace partners with AODocs and LumApps to offer a SharePoint Server alternative
item.description: Google Workspace has expanded its ecosystem by partnering with AODocs and LumApps, integrating their specialized solutions to enhance content management and employee experience. AODocs will provide advanced document lifecycle and compliance capabilities, while LumApps will offer an AI-powered employee experience platform, both designed to seamlessly extend Google Workspace's functionality for enterprise clients.

item.title: Now generally available: Convert your Client-side encrypted Google Sheets after a Vault or Takeout export
item.description: Google Sheets now offers full client-side encryption (CSE) support, providing enhanced data privacy and security for highly sensitive spreadsheet content. Rolling out from September 2, 2025, this feature ensures data is encrypted before leaving the user's device, offering an additional layer of protection particularly vital for regulated industries.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - September 12, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for September 12, 2025, highlights Gemini summaries on the Drive Home page and NotebookLM's new flashcards and quizzes for education. It also covers condensed version history in Google Sheets and the beta launch of the Shared Signals Framework, detailing advancements in AI insights, data management, and security.

item.title: See file summaries on the Home page in Google Drive
item.description: Gemini is now integrated into the Google Drive Home page, providing AI-generated summaries of recently accessed or important documents. Rolling out from August 26, 2025, this feature helps users quickly grasp the essence of their files, significantly enhancing information retrieval and productivity without requiring them to open each document.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - September 5, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for September 5, 2025, highlights Gemini's ability to refine text in Google Slides and create videos from Slides in Google Vids. It also covers the introduction of Google AI Pro for Education and a new document scanning UI in Google Drive mobile, showcasing advancements in AI-powered content creation, education, and mobile productivity.

item.title: Revamping the scanned documents editing experience in Google Drive on Android devices
item.description: Google Drive on mobile devices is receiving a new document scanning user interface, enhancing the experience of digitizing physical documents. Rolling out from August 19, 2025, this update makes it easier for users to capture, organize, and manage physical paperwork digitally, significantly improving mobile productivity and document management.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - August 29, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for August 29, 2025, highlights new features such as daily exports for Google Drive, and the ability to convert images to videos with Google Vids. It also covers AI avatars in Vids, transcript-based video editing, and enhanced Gemini features in Google Sheets, showcasing advancements in data management, AI-powered video creation, and spreadsheet intelligence.

item.title: Daily Exports for Google Drive inventory reporting is now available in open beta
item.description: Google Drive is introducing daily data exports, allowing administrators to schedule regular backups of their organization's Drive data. This feature, rolling out from August 12, 2025, enhances data governance, compliance, and disaster recovery strategies by ensuring consistent and automated data preservation.

item.title: Adding image support to Gemini in the side panel of Google Drive
item.description: Gemini can now be used on images stored in Google Drive, providing AI-powered analysis, categorization, and editing suggestions for visual content. This integration, rolling out from August 12, 2025, enhances asset management and content creation by allowing users to leverage AI for their image libraries directly within Drive.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - August 22, 2025
item.description: The Weekly Recap for August 22, 2025, highlights the ability to edit Google Drive videos directly in Google Vids and new pre-configured appointment booking in Google Calendar. It also covers Gemini Live integration with Calendar, Tasks, and Keep, alongside ServiceNow integration with Google Chat and Sheets, showcasing advancements in video editing, scheduling, AI integration, and enterprise tools.

item.title: Edit your Google Drive videos in your browser, using Google Vids
item.description: Google Vids now allows users to directly edit videos stored in Google Drive, streamlining the video production workflow within the Workspace ecosystem. Rolling out from August 5, 2025, this feature enables seamless content creation and collaboration by eliminating the need to download and re-upload video files for editing.

item.title: Receive more in-depth responses from Gemini in Google Drive on PDF queries
item.description: Gemini in Google Drive is being enhanced to support larger PDFs and longer contexts, allowing users to interact with documents up to 2 million words or approximately 3,000 pages for summarization, questions, and extracting information. This capability is rolling out to users with Gemini for Google Workspace or the Gemini Business and Enterprise add-ons, significantly improving information retrieval from extensive documents.

item.title: NotebookLM is now available to all education users
item.description: NotebookLM, an AI-powered note-taking and research assistant, is now generally available to all Google Workspace users globally, expanding beyond its initial beta for Education customers. This tool allows users to upload documents, PDFs, and Google Slides to generate summaries, outlines, and ask questions, enhancing productivity and knowledge management.

item.title: Build and deploy a single app across Chat, Gmail, Calendar, Drive and more with the Workspace add-ons framework
item.description: Google Workspace is rolling out the capability for developers to build and deploy a single application that functions seamlessly across Google Chat, Google Docs, and Google Sheets. This new framework aims to streamline development and enhance app functionality within the Google Workspace ecosystem, reducing redundant development efforts for multi-platform integrations.

item.title: Train multiple models for AI classification for Google Drive on demand
item.description: Google Drive's AI classification for data loss prevention (DLP) is being enhanced with multi-model support, allowing administrators to select different AI models for improved classification accuracy, and on-demand model training for custom data sets. This update provides more granular control and better precision in identifying and protecting sensitive information within Google Drive.

item.title: Because you asked: Our top 10 Workspace productivity tips
item.description: This article shares the top 10 productivity tips for maximizing Google Workspace, focusing on features that streamline workflows, enhance collaboration, and improve time management. Tips include leveraging smart canvases, utilizing focus time in Calendar, mastering keyboard shortcuts, and organizing files efficiently in Google Drive to boost individual and team efficiency.

item.title: July Workspace feature drop: Create videos with Veo 3 in the Gemini app, summarize videos with Gemini in Drive, and more
item.description: The July Google Workspace feature drop introduces significant enhancements, including advanced capabilities for Google Veo 3 for creative content generation and AI-powered video summaries in Google Drive. These updates aim to boost productivity and collaboration by enabling users to quickly grasp video content and efficiently create high-quality visual assets, leveraging generative AI.

item.title: Thumbnail previews will now show on video progress bar in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is enhancing its video playback experience with thumbnail previews that indicate video progress when hovering over the seek bar, similar to YouTube. This feature allows users to quickly navigate to specific points in a video, improving efficiency for reviewing and accessing content stored in Drive.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - July 18, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for July 18, 2025, highlight new features including the general availability of enhanced Google Chat interoperability with external platforms and Google Drive's AI classification updates with multi-model support. Other updates cover improved audit logs for Google Groups and Classroom, and increased Gemini 1.5 Pro rate limits for developers.

item.title: Now Generally Available: Migrate files from Microsoft SharePoint Online to Google Drive
item.description: The migration tool for moving Microsoft SharePoint Online content to Google Workspace is now generally available, enabling organizations to seamlessly transfer files and data. This full rollout follows a successful open beta, facilitating a smoother transition for enterprises looking to consolidate their cloud storage and collaboration platforms.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - July 11, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for July 11, 2025, announce the general availability of the Microsoft SharePoint Online migration tool to Google Workspace and the 'Extract and Categorize with Gemini' feature in AppSheet. Other updates include Gemini's availability in Google Docs on iOS and the ability to link Google Calendar booking pages in Gmail.

item.title: How-to guide: Achieving digital sovereignty with Google Workspace
item.description: Google Workspace is enabling organizations to achieve digital sovereignty through robust data residency options, transparent security controls, and adherence to local regulations, particularly crucial for public sector and highly regulated industries. This commitment ensures that data processing and storage comply with national requirements, providing customers with greater control and confidence over their digital assets and operations.

item.title: Search for embedded content in Google Sites
item.description: Google Sites is enhancing its search capabilities to include embedded content, allowing users to find information within embedded Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and other files. This update improves discoverability and efficiency when searching for specific information within a Google Site.

item.title: Drive IRM Update: More Control for File Owners and Shared Drive Managers
item.description: Google Drive is introducing more granular Information Rights Management (IRM) controls for file owners and Shared Drive managers, allowing them to restrict download, print, and copy options for specific users or groups. This enhancement provides greater control over sensitive data and improves data security within Google Drive.

item.title: Use Gemini in Google Drive to execute basic organizational tasks
item.description: Gemini in Google Drive is being enhanced to execute basic organizational tasks, such as finding, categorizing, and summarizing files, through natural language prompts. This AI-powered capability aims to boost user productivity and streamline file management by simplifying complex operations within Drive.

item.title: Google Drive Events API now available in Developer Public Preview
item.description: The Google Drive Events API is now generally available, allowing developers to programmatically access and monitor changes to files and folders in Google Drive in real-time. This API enhances integrations with third-party applications and enables more sophisticated automation and data synchronization workflows.

item.title: Because you asked: Achieving more with Google Workspace
item.description: This article provides practical tips for achieving more with Google Workspace, focusing on optimizing daily workflows and leveraging built-in collaboration features. Strategies include utilizing Google Calendar for efficient scheduling, organizing files in Google Drive, enhancing communication with Google Chat, and employing Smart Canvas to streamline document creation and teamwork.

item.title: Google Workspace: Enabling FINRA compliance and enhanced capabilities for Financial Services organizations
item.description: Google Workspace is enhancing its capabilities to enable FINRA compliance for financial services firms, addressing stringent regulatory requirements for data retention, e-discovery, and secure communication. New features and integrations are designed to help organizations meet industry standards while leveraging Google Workspace's collaborative and AI-powered tools, like Gemini, for increased productivity and efficiency.

item.title: FINRA Compliance for Google Workspace: Google Drive and Calendar Updates
item.description: Google Workspace has achieved FINRA compliance for Google Drive and Google Calendar, making these services suitable for financial institutions requiring strict regulatory adherence. This certification ensures that data handling and record-keeping meet the high standards set by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - June 27, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for June 27, 2025, announce the general availability of locked Google Groups and hardware key certificate management for Gmail's client-side encryption. Other updates include FINRA compliance for Google Drive and Calendar, and the availability of Google Vids and Gemini in Google Classroom for Education customers.

item.title: See summaries of even more file types directly in Google Chat
item.description: Google Chat is expanding its capability to provide AI-powered summaries of more shared file types, allowing users to quickly grasp the content of attached documents without opening them. This feature, leveraging Gemini, enhances productivity by making information more accessible within chat conversations.

item.title: Introducing PDF summary cards in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is introducing AI-powered PDF summary cards, providing quick overviews of PDF content without requiring users to open the full document. This feature, leveraging Gemini, enhances productivity by allowing users to rapidly assess the relevance and key takeaways of documents, rolling out to Gemini for Google Workspace customers.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - June 6, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for June 6, 2025, announce the expansion of Companion Mode to Android and iOS for Google Meet and enhanced host controls for joining requests. Other updates include AI-powered PDF summary cards in Google Drive, the "Help me create" and "Summarize responses" features in Google Forms, and new migration tools for Microsoft Exchange Online content.

item.title: Stay up to date on the latest changes to your files in Drive using “Catch me up”
item.description: Google Drive is introducing a new "Catch me up" feature, powered by Gemini, that provides AI-generated summaries of recent activity and changes within a document or shared folder. This tool helps users quickly get up to speed on collaborative projects, improving productivity and information recall.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 30, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for May 30, 2025, announce the ability to present content from a camera in Google Meet and support for suggestions in client-side encrypted Google Docs. Other updates include Gemini's capability to upload code folders and GitHub repositories, improved Google Meet and Cisco Webex interoperability, and the "Catch me up" feature in Google Drive.

item.title: Democratizing app development using AppSheet with Gemini
item.description: Google is democratizing app development by integrating Gemini into AppSheet, its no-code development platform, empowering citizen developers to create powerful applications with greater ease and speed. This AI integration allows users to build custom apps by simply describing their needs in natural language, automating complex logic and data connections to enhance business processes across Google Workspace.

item.title: Understand your videos much faster using Gemini in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is integrating Gemini to help users understand videos by providing AI-powered summaries, key topics, and answer questions directly from video content stored in Drive. This feature transforms video files into more interactive and searchable assets, significantly boosting productivity for content review and analysis.

item.title: Introducing video engagement insights in Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive is introducing video engagement insights for videos stored on the platform, providing creators with data on viewer behavior, such as watch times and popular segments. This feature helps content creators understand audience engagement and optimize their video content strategies.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 23, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for May 23, 2025, announce Gemini summaries in Google Chat available in four new languages and Gemini summary cards in the Gmail app. Other updates include improved Google Calendar interoperability with Microsoft Office 365, Gemini's ability to understand videos in Google Drive, and new video engagement insights for Google Drive.

item.title: Because you asked: Spring clean your calendar with Workspace
item.description: This article offers practical tips for 'spring cleaning' Google Calendar and overall Google Workspace to enhance productivity and reduce digital clutter. Recommendations include decluttering old events, utilizing focus time, streamlining notification settings, and regularly reviewing shared calendars to optimize scheduling and improve time management for a more efficient workday.

item.title: Available in Open Beta: Migrate files from Microsoft SharePoint Online to Google Drive
item.description: Google Workspace announced the open beta for migrating Microsoft SharePoint Online content to Google Workspace, offering organizations a streamlined tool for transferring files and data. This initiative aims to simplify transitions for enterprises consolidating their cloud infrastructure and collaboration tools.

item.title: Available in beta: Edit client-side encrypted Microsoft Word files with Google Docs
item.description: Google Docs now allows users to edit client-side encrypted (CSE) Microsoft Word files directly, providing enhanced security for collaborative work on sensitive documents. This feature improves interoperability and maintains data protection when working with Microsoft Office files within Google Workspace.

item.title: Google Vault improves Google Drive search and export: now with document ID and more shared drive options
item.description: Google Vault is receiving updates to its search and export capabilities for Google Drive, providing enhanced tools for eDiscovery, compliance, and information governance. These improvements enable administrators to more effectively manage and retrieve data from Drive for legal and regulatory purposes.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 16, 2025
item.description: Google Workspace Release Notes for May 16, 2025, cover deep research updates for Gemini from I/O 2025 and the open beta for Microsoft SharePoint Online migration to Google Workspace. Other announcements include Gemini's integration with Canvas for quiz generation, expanded language support for Google Classroom, and the ability to edit client-side encrypted Microsoft Word files with Google Docs.

item.title: Use Gemini in Drive to interact with folders in 20+ additional languages
item.description: Gemini in Google Drive is expanding its language support and adding folder-level analysis, allowing users to summarize, query, and organize content across entire folders in multiple languages. This enhancement significantly improves information retrieval and productivity for multi-lingual teams managing large volumes of documents.

item.title: Wake Forest University redefines cybersecurity with Google Workspace for Education Plus
item.description: Wake Forest University is redefining its cybersecurity posture by implementing Google Workspace Education Plus, enhancing protection for its 8,700 students and staff. The advanced security features, including robust data loss prevention and sophisticated threat detection, help the university safeguard sensitive information, ensure compliance, and build a resilient digital environment against evolving cyber threats.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - May 2, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for May 2, 2025, highlight two significant updates: users can now initiate conversations with Gemini directly within Google Drive about specific files to gain insights. Additionally, Google Voice has introduced three-way call support and received an updated user interface, enhancing communication capabilities.

item.title: Start a conversation with Gemini in the side panel of Google Drive about specific files
item.description: Google Drive now allows users to start conversations with Gemini directly about specific files like Docs, Sheets, Slides, and PDFs, leveraging the file's content for context. Gemini can summarize documents, answer questions, and provide insights, enhancing productivity and understanding of file contents. This feature is available to Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers, with a gradual rollout from May 2, 2025.

item.title: Enhance Your Organization’s Security with Out-of-Domain File Warnings in Google Workspace
item.description: Google Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides are introducing new out-of-domain file warnings to enhance data security for Google Workspace users. These warnings will alert users when they open files originating from outside their organization's trusted domain, helping to prevent accidental data leakage. This feature, gradually rolling out from April 24, 2025, is particularly beneficial for users leveraging Advanced Protection Program or strict Workspace security settings.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - April 25, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for April 25, 2025, announced several updates, including the expansion of NotebookLM's Audio Overviews to 35 new languages and the introduction of out-of-domain file warnings in Drive, Docs, Sheets, and Slides for enhanced security. Additionally, Google Vids is now available for Business Starter, Enterprise Starter, and Nonprofits editions, while Gmail users can enjoy new emoji reactions.

item.title: Three best practices to simplify eDiscovery exports and litigation holds with Google Vault
item.description: Google Vault offers three best practices to simplify eDiscovery exports and litigation holds, crucial for legal and compliance teams managing data within Google Workspace. These practices include organizing data effectively, leveraging advanced search and export functionalities, and implementing consistent retention policies to ensure legal defensibility and streamline complex data requests.

item.title: Data classifications labels for Gmail are now generally available
item.description: Gmail Data Classification Labels are now generally available, providing administrators with the ability to apply labels like "Internal" or "Confidential" to emails. This feature helps enforce Data Loss Prevention (DLP) rules, automate security policies, and educate users on sensitive data handling practices. Available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus, Education Plus, and existing Drive and Chat classification labels, it enhances data security and compliance across organizations.

item.title: How-to guide: Adopting Zero-Trust security with Google Workspace
item.description: This article outlines a strategic approach to adopting Zero Trust security principles within Google Workspace, emphasizing continuous verification and least privilege access. Key steps include implementing strong authentication with passkeys, micro-segmentation, and advanced threat detection, providing comprehensive guidance for organizations to enhance their cybersecurity posture and protect sensitive data from evolving threats.

item.title: Pre-configure the Google Workspace apps admin setting for the Gemini app ahead of general availability
item.description: Google Workspace administrators can now pre-configure user access to Google Workspace applications like Gmail, Drive, and Docs within Gemini, ahead of its general availability. This crucial administrative control enables organizations to proactively manage data access and enforce compliance policies before Gemini's full rollout. The feature is available for Google Workspace Business, Enterprise, Education, and Nonprofits editions, ensuring controlled AI integration.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - March 28, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for March 28, 2025, introduced dynamic layouts for Google Meet and additional language support for Gemini in Drive's PDF viewer. Google Slides gained proportional scaling for objects, while Google Drive received new nudges for Gemini, and Gmail's "Help me write" expanded to more languages. Google Classroom's mobile app also expanded language support, and Google Drive now runs on ARM-compatible Windows PCs. Lastly, Google Vids received new "Help me create" capabilities.

item.title: Gemini in Drive PDF Viewer is now available in 20+ additional languages
item.description: Gemini's integration within the Google Drive PDF viewer is now accessible in additional languages, enabling users to leverage AI for summarizing, querying, and extracting information from PDFs in diverse linguistic contexts. This enhances productivity and document comprehension for a broader global audience. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: The ability to run Google Drive on Arm-compatible Windows PCs is now generally available
item.description: Google Drive for desktop now officially supports ARM-compatible Windows PCs, enabling users with modern devices featuring Snapdragon processors to run the application natively. This compatibility enhancement is expected to improve performance and extend battery life for these specific Windows users. This update broadens Google Drive's accessibility and optimization across different hardware architectures.

item.title: Get started with Gemini in Google Drive quickly with new “nudges”
item.description: Google Drive is rolling out new "nudges" designed to encourage users to leverage Gemini for tasks such as summarizing documents, generating new content, or organizing files. These contextual prompts aim to boost Gemini adoption and enhance productivity directly within Google Drive. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, and Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: 5 ways to help your small business thrive with Google Drive
item.description: Google Drive offers five essential ways to help small businesses thrive, focusing on secure collaboration, efficient file management, and robust data backup. These include easy sharing, version control, offline access, integration with Google Workspace apps, and reliable cloud storage, empowering small businesses to improve productivity and ensure business continuity.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - March 14, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for March 14, 2025, announced several updates, including consent reconfirmation for under-18 Education users and AppSheet user authentication bypass. Gemini Gems (Deep Research) became available to more Workspace customers, while Google Meet expanded language support for "Take notes for me," recorded captions, and transcripts. Authenticated AppSheet apps can now be embedded in Google Sites, and Google Docs client-side encryption supports export to Microsoft Word. More AI features rolled out for Business/Enterprise, Gemini side panel added four languages, and Google Meet hardware can view guest lists. Finally, Gemini in Drive gained file/folder creation, and Gemini in Gmail can add Calendar events.

item.title: BLADE takes air travel to new heights with Google Workspace
item.description: BLADE, a leading urban air mobility company, is taking air travel to new heights by leveraging Google Workspace to streamline operations and enhance collaboration. Google Workspace, including Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Meet, enables BLADE to manage complex logistics, coordinate flights, and communicate seamlessly across its global teams, supporting efficient customer service and rapid expansion.

item.title: Create files and folders using Gemini in the side panel of Google Drive
item.description: Gemini's integration into Google Drive now enables users to create new files and folders using natural language prompts, leveraging AI to streamline file management and content creation. This enhances productivity by allowing users to verbally or textually command Drive actions. The feature is available to Google Workspace users with Gemini Business, Enterprise, or Education upgrades, as well as Gemini Advanced subscribers.

item.title: Google Cloud named a Leader in the 2025 Forrester Data Security Platforms Wave
item.description: Google Cloud has been recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Data Security Platforms, Q1 2025 report, underscoring its robust capabilities in data protection and security. This achievement highlights Google Cloud's comprehensive suite of tools, including those integrated with Google Workspace, for safeguarding sensitive data, ensuring compliance, and providing advanced threat protection for enterprises.

item.title: Google Workspace Updates Weekly Recap - February 28, 2025
item.description: The Google Workspace release notes for February 28, 2025, announced several updates, including expanded AI voiceovers in Google Vids and new inventory reporting for richer insights in Google Drive. Google Voice introduced SIP Link support in new countries, call delegation, and the ability to transfer personal numbers to Workspace accounts. Additionally, HubSpot integration with Google Chat was launched, and Google Drive now supports video transcripts.

item.title: New Google Drive Inventory Reporting enhancements provide even richer insights into file permissions
item.description: Google Drive is launching enhanced inventory reporting, offering administrators richer insights into organizational Drive usage, file types, and sharing patterns. This provides crucial data for robust data governance, security audits, and efficient storage management. The feature is available for Google Workspace Enterprise Plus and Education Plus customers, empowering better oversight of cloud storage.

item.title: Forum Virium Helsinki builds a thriving workplace with Google Workspace and Gemini
item.description: Forum Virium Helsinki, a municipal innovation company, is building a thriving workplace by leveraging Google Workspace to enhance collaboration and operational efficiency. The suite of tools, including Google Docs, Sheets, and Meet, enables their project-based teams to communicate seamlessly, manage projects effectively, and foster an innovative environment focused on developing smart city solutions for Helsinki.

item.title: Enhancing video navigation and accessibility with Google Drive video transcripts
item.description: Google Drive now automatically generates transcripts for uploaded video files, significantly enhancing accessibility, searchability, and comprehension of video content. This feature allows users to quickly find specific information within videos and aids in content review. It is available to Google Workspace Business Standard, Plus, Enterprise Standard, Plus, Education Plus, Teaching and Learning Upgrade, and Gemini Add-on users, improving video asset management.

item.title: From checkboxes to checkmates: How Google Workspace can help you achieve CMMC 2.0 compliance
item.description: Google Workspace helps organizations achieve CMMC 2.0 compliance by providing robust security features, data governance controls, and audit capabilities essential for handling Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI). The platform's integrated security, including advanced threat protection and data loss prevention, allows defense contractors and others to meet stringent government requirements, ensuring data integrity and confidentiality.

item.title: Three do’s and don’ts to get the most out of your migration to Google Workspace
item.description: This article outlines three crucial 'dos and don'ts' for a successful migration to Google Workspace, emphasizing planning, communication, and training. Key recommendations include thorough pre-migration assessment, phased rollout, and leveraging Google's migration tools, while advising against insufficient user training or neglecting data hygiene, ensuring a smooth transition and maximizing platform adoption.

item.title: How-to guide: Defending against malware and phishing attacks
item.description: Google Workspace provides a comprehensive guide to defending against malware and phishing attacks, outlining proactive security measures and best practices for users and administrators. Recommendations include enabling advanced phishing protection in Gmail, utilizing Safe Browsing, implementing multi-factor authentication, and providing ongoing security awareness training to mitigate these prevalent cyber threats.

item.title: Uber resolves issues faster with Google AppSheet and Google Apps Script
item.description: Uber is resolving issues faster by leveraging Google AppSheet and Google Apps Script to create custom applications that streamline internal operations and enhance productivity for its global workforce. These no-code and low-code solutions automate complex workflows, integrate with Google Workspace data sources like Google Sheets, and reduce manual intervention, improving efficiency across various departments.
